usefulItems: large non-stick frying pan, grill, hob
title: Socca with Tuna, Olives and Capers

ingredients.content: 50 g olive oil, plus extra for frying
100 g tinned tuna in oil, drained and flaked
1 Tbsp pickled capers, drained and rinsed
2 fresh basil leaves, shredded, for garnish

preparations.content: Place chickpea flour, water, oil and salt in mixing bowl then whisk <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to rest for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, rinse mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Place onion, garlic and oil in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/100°C/speed <b>.
Add tomato, tuna, olives, capers, oregano and black pepper then chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and set aside while cooking pancake.

Preheat grill to 220°C. Pour enough olive oil into a large oven-proof non-stick frying pan to cover the base. Heat over a medium-high heat then pour in rested batter. Cook for 8-10 minutes until pancake starts to brown at the edges.
Place frying pan under grill for 8-10 minutes until brown on top.

Transfer pancake to a plate then arrange topping from mixing bowl over the top. Scatter with basil leaves then sprinkle with chilli flakes (if using). Slice into quarters and serve, with a salad if desired.

hintsAndTricks: Add half a red pepper (cut in quarters) in step 3.

Socca are crepes made from chickpea flour, a Provençal street food, cooked quickly on a sizzling griddle and eaten on the go. This version, which browns under the grill, is something between a sturdy crepe and a soft flatbread. The chickpea flour gives it a tender, almost custard-like texture. Serve warm as a light lunch or evening meal with accompaniments.
